properties.description: The 'shortName' field provides a concise name that describes the resource that is being documented. It is the appropriate place to store a filename associated with other storage systems. Example(s): vernal-data-1999
properties.title: Short Name

properties.description: The 'title' field provides a description of the resource that is being documented that is long enough to differentiate it from other similar resources. Example(s): Vernal pool amphibian density data, Isla Vista, 1990-1996.
properties.title: Title

properties.description: Contains the full name of the organization that is associated with the resource. This field is intended to describe which institution or overall organization is associated with the resource being described.
properties.title: Creator(s) - Organizations

properties.description: The given name field can be used for first name of the individual associated with the resource, or for any other names that are not intended to be alphabetized, (as appropriate).
properties.title: Given Name

properties.description: The surname field is used for the last name of the individual associated with the resource. This is typically the family name of an individual, for example, the name by which s/he is referred to in citations.
properties.title: Family Name

properties.description: This field is intended to be used instead of a particular person or full organization name. If the associated person who holds the role changes frequently, then Position Name would be used for consistency.
properties.title: Position

properties.description: The given name field can be used for first name of the individual associated with the resource, or for any other names that are not intended to be alphabetized, (as appropriate).
properties.title: Given Name

properties.description: The surname field is used for the last name of the individual associated with the resource. This is typically the family name of an individual, for example, the name by which s/he is referred to in citations.
properties.title: Family Name

properties.description: The role field contains information about role a person plays in a research project.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: A brief overview of the resource that is being documented. The abstract should include basic information that summarizes the resource.
properties.title: Description

properties.description: A brief overview of the resource that is being documented. The abstract should include basic information that summarizes the resource.
properties.title: Description

properties.description: This field names a keyword or key phrase that concisely describes the resource or is related to the resource. Each keyword field should contain one and only one keyword (i.e., keywords should not be separated by commas or other delimiters). Example(s): biodiversity
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The eml-coverage module contains fields for describing the coverage of a resource in terms of time, space, and taxonomy.
A short text description of a dataset's geographic areal domain. eg. Yellowstone National Park
properties.title: Description

properties.description: The maximum altitude extent of coverage for the bounding box that is being described. The maximum altitude should be in reference to a known datum, which should be part of the geographicDescription. Example(s): 100.6 -10
properties.title: Maximum Altitude

properties.description: The minimum altitude extent of coverage for the bounding box that is being described. The minimum altitude should be in reference to a known datum (e.g., Mean Sea Level), which should be part of the geographicDescription. Example(s): 100.6 -12
properties.title: Minimum Altitude

properties.description: The given name field can be used for first name of the individual associated with the resource, or for any other names that are not intended to be alphabetized, (as appropriate).
properties.title: Given Name

properties.description: The surname field is used for the last name of the individual associated with the resource. This is typically the family name of an individual, for example, the name by which s/he is referred to in citations.
properties.title: Family Name
